{{Redirect|RBE}} {{distinguish|text=the tissue sensitivity weighting factor W<sub>f</sub> used in calculating the [[effective dose (radiation safety)]]}} {{more citations needed|date=October 2013}}
In [[radiobiology]], the '''relative biological effectiveness''' (often abbreviated as '''RBE''') is the ratio of biological effectiveness of one type of [[ionizing radiation]] relative to another, given the same [[absorbed dose|amount of absorbed energy]]. The RBE is an empirical value that varies depending on the particles, energies involved, and which biological effects are deemed relevant.
==Application== [[File:SI Radiation dose units.png|thumb|400px|ICRP Protection Dose quantities in SI units]] In ionizing radiation [[dosimetry]] RBE is now represented in the recommendations of the [[International Commission on Radiological Protection]] (ICRP) by the [[radiation weighting factor]], (W<sub>R</sub>) for each type of radiation; it was formerly the quality factor (Q).<ref name="icrp92">{{cite journal|last=Sinclair|first=Dr. W. K. | name-list-format = vanc |title=Relative biological effectiveness (RBE), quality factor (Q) and radiation weighting factor (Wr)|journal=Annals of the ICRP|date=January 2003|volume=33|series=ICRP Publication 92|issue=4|url=http://www.icrp.org/publication.asp?id=ICRP%20Publication%2092|isbn=978-0-08-044311-9 }}</ref>
These weighting factors convert [[absorbed dose]] (measured in SI units of [[gray (unit)|gray]]s or non-SI [[rad (unit)|rad]]s) into formal biological [[equivalent dose]] for radiation exposure (measured in units of [[sievert]]s or [[rem (unit)|rem]]). The higher the RBE or weighting factor for a type of radiation, the more damaging it is, and this is incorporated into the calculation to convert from gray to sievert units (seeaccompanying diagram).
The relative biological effectiveness for radiation of type ''R'' on a tissue of type ''X'' is defined as the ratio :<math>RBE= \frac{D_X}{D_R}</math> where ''D''<sub>''X''</sub> is a reference [[absorbed dose]] of radiation of a standard type ''X'', and ''D''<sub>''R''</sub> is the absorbed dose of radiation of type ''R'' that causes the same amount of biological damage. Both doses are quantified by the amount of [[energy]] absorbed in the cells.
Different types of radiation have different biological effectiveness mainly because they transfer their energy to the tissue in different ways. Photons and beta particles have a low [[linear energy transfer]] coefficient, meaning that they ionize atoms in the tissue that are spaced by several hundred [[nanometer]]s (several tenths of a [[micrometre|micrometer]]) apart, along their path. In contrast, the much more massive alpha particles and neutrons leave a denser trail of ionized atoms in their wake, spaced about one tenth of a nanometer apart (i.e., less than one-thousandth of the typical distance between ionizations for photons and beta particles).
The concept of RBE is relevant in medicine, such as in [[radiology]] and [[radiotherapy]], and to the evaluation of risks and consequences of [[radioactive contamination]] in various contexts, such as [[nuclear power plant]] operation, [[nuclear fuel]] disposal and reprocessing, [[nuclear weapon]]s, [[uranium mining]], and ionizing [[ionizing radiation#Monitoring and controlling exposure|radiation safety]].
Radiation weighting factors that go from physical energy to biological effect must not be confused with [[tissue weighting factor]]s. The tissue weighting factors are used to convert an [[equivalent dose]] to a given tissue in the body, to an [[effective radiation dose]], a number that provides an estimation of total danger to the whole organism, as a result of the radiation dose to part of the body.
==Adoption of weighting factors== [[File:Neutron radiation weighting factor as a function of kinetic energy.gif|thumb|350px|The radiation weighting factor for neutrons has been revised over time and remains controversial.]] To bypass the complexity of tissue dependence, the ICRP defined standard radiation weighting factors, independently of tissue type, to be used for risk and exposure assessment in radiology and the nuclear industry.<ref name="icrp103">{{cite journal|title=The 2007 Recommendations of the International Commission on Radiological Protection|journal=Annals of the ICRP|year=2007|volume=37|series=ICRP publication 103|issue=2–4|url=http://www.icrp.org/publication.asp?id=ICRP%20Publication%20103|accessdate=17 May 2012|isbn=978-0-7020-3048-2 }}</ref> These values are conservatively chosen to be greater than the bulk of experimental values observed for the most sensitive cell types, with respect to external (external to the cell) sources. Values for internal sources for heavy ions, such as a recoil nucleus, have not been developed. The ICRP 2007 standard values for relative effectiveness are given below.
Radiation weighting factors ''W<sub>R</sub>'' (formerly termed ''Q'' factor) used to represent relative biological effectiveness according to ICRP report 103<ref name="icrp103"/>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Radiation !! Energy ''W<sub>R</sub>'' (formerly ''Q'') |- | x-rays, gamma rays, beta particles, muons || 1 |- | neutrons (< 1 MeV) || 2.5 + 18.2''e''<sup>-[ln(''E'')]<sup>2</sup>/6</sup> |- | neutrons (1 - 50 MeV) || 5.0 + 17.0''e''<sup>-[ln(2''E'')]<sup>2</sup>/6</sup> |- | neutrons (> 50 MeV) || 2.5 + 3.25''e''<sup>-[ln(0.04''E'')]<sup>2</sup>/6</sup> |- | protons, charged pions || 2 |- | alpha particles, nuclear fission products, heavy nuclei || 20 |}
Thus, for example, a given amount of energy absorbed in the form of 15 keV neutrons should be assumed to produce 10 times the damage caused by an equal amount of energy absorbed as X-rays or gamma rays.
==Experimental methods == [[File:Rbe definition.png|thumb|right|300px|LD-50 limit for CHO-K1 cell line irradiated by photons (blue curve) and by carbon ions (red curve).]] Typically the evaluation of relative biological effectiveness is done on various types of living cells grown in [[culture medium]], including [[prokaryote|prokaryotic]] cells such as [[bacteria]], simple [[Eukaryote|eukaryotic]] cells such as single celled plants, and advanced eukaryotic cells derived from organisms such as [[rat]]s. The doses are adjusted to the [[LD-50]] point; that is, to the amount that will cause 50% of the cells to become unable to undergo [[mitotic division]] (or, for bacteria, [[binary fission]]), thus being effectively sterilized — even if they can still carry out other cellular functions.
The types ''R'' of ionizing radiation most considered in RBE evaluation are [[X-ray]]s and [[gamma radiation]] (both consisting of [[photon]]s), [[alpha radiation]]s ([[helium-4]] nuclei), [[beta radiation]] ([[electron]]s and [[positron]]s), [[neutron radiation]], and heavy [[atomic nucleus|nuclei]], including the fragments of [[nuclear fission]]. For some kinds of radiation, the RBE is strongly dependent on the energy of the individual particles.
===Dependence on tissue type=== Early on it was found that X-rays, gamma radiation, and beta radiation were essentially equivalent for all cell types. Therefore, the standard radiation type ''X'' is generally an X-ray beam with 250 [[electronvolt|keV]] photons. As a result, the relative biological effectiveness of beta and photon radiation is essentially 1.
For other radiation types, the RBE is not a well-defined physical quantity, since it varies somewhat with the type of tissue and with the precise place of absorption within the cell. Thus, for example, the RBE for alpha radiation is 2–3 when measured on [[bacteria]], 4–6 for simple [[Eukaryote|eukaryotic]] [[cell (biology)|cell]]s, and 6–8 for higher eukaryotic cells. According to one source it may be much higher (6500 with X rays as the reference) on ovocytes.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=Nagasawa|first=H.|last2=Little|first2=J. B.|date=1992-11-15|title=Induction of sister chromatid exchanges by extremely low doses of alpha-particles|journal=Cancer Research|volume=52|issue=22|pages=6394–6396|issn=0008-5472|pmid=1423287}}</ref> The RBE of neutrons is 4–6 for bacteria, 8–12 for simple eukaryotic cells, and 12–16 for higher eukaryotic cells.
===Dependence on source location=== In the early experiments, the sources of radiation were all external to the cells that were irradiated. However, since alpha particles cannot traverse the outermost dead layer of human skin, they can do significant damage only if they come from the decay of atoms inside the body. Since the range of an alpha particle is typically about the diameter of a single eukaryotic cell, the precise location of the emitting atom in the tissue cells becomes significant.
For this reason, it has been suggested that the health impact of contamination by alpha emitters might have been substantially underestimated.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Winters TH, Di Franza JR | title = Radioactivity in cigarette smoking | journal = The New England Journal of Medicine | volume = 306 | issue = 6 | pages = 364–5 | date = February 1982 | pmid = 7054712 | doi = 10.1056/NEJM198202113060613 }}</ref> Measurements of RBE with external sources also neglect the ionization caused by the [[recoil]] of the parent-nucleus due to the alpha decay. While the recoil of the parent-nucleus of the decaying atom typically carries only about 2% of the energy of the alpha-particle that is emitted by the decaying atom, its range is extremely short (about 2–3 angstroms), due to its high [[electric charge]] and high [[mass]]. The parent nucleus is required to recoil, upon emission of an [[alpha particle]], with a discrete kinetic energy due to [[conservation of momentum]]. Thus, all of the ionization energy from the recoil-nucleus is deposited in an extremely small volume near its original location, typically in the cell nucleus on the chromosomes, which have an affinity for heavy metals.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Zhu G, Zhang CY | title = Functional nucleic acid-based sensors for heavy metal ion assays | journal = The Analyst | volume = 139 | issue = 24 | pages = 6326–42 | date = December 2014 | pmid = 25356810 | doi = 10.1039/C4AN01069H | bibcode = 2014Ana...139.6326Z }}</ref><ref>{{cite book | chapter = Chapter 8: Metal/Nucleic-Acid Interactions | first = Jacqueline K. | last = Barton | name-list-format = vanc | editor-last1 = Bertini | editor-first1 = Ivano | editor-last2 = Gray | editor-first2 = Harry B. | editor-last3 = Lippard | editor-first3 =Stephen J. | editor-last4 = Valentine | editor-first4 = Joan Selverstone | title = Bioinorganic Chemistry | date = 1994 | publisher = Univ. Science Books | location = Mill Valley, Calif. | isbn = 0-935702-57-1 | pages = 455–503 | chapter-url = http://authors.library.caltech.edu/25052/9/BioinCh_chapter8.pdf}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |doi=10.1016/0076-6879(85)14016-4 |chapter=Heavy metal ion-nucleic acid interaction |title=Diffraction Methods for Biological Macromolecules Part A |volume=114 |pages=156–67 |series=Methods in Enzymology |year=1985 |last1=Kim |first1=Sung-Hou |last2=Shin |first2=Whan-Chul |last3=Warrant |first3=R.W. | name-list-format = vanc |isbn=978-0-12-182014-5 }}</ref> The bulk of studies, using sources that are external to the cell, have yielded RBEs between 10 and 20.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Chambers DB, Osborne RV, Garva AL | title = Choosing an alpha radiation weighting factor for doses to non-human biota | journal = Journal of Environmental Radioactivity | volume = 87 | issue = 1 | pages = 1–14 | year = 2006 | pmid = 16377039 | doi = 10.1016/j.jenvrad.2005.10.009 }}</ref>
==History== In 1931, Failla and Henshaw reported on determination of the relative biological effectiveness (RBE) of x rays and γ rays. This appears to be the first use of the term ‘RBE’. The authors noted that RBE was dependent on the experimental system being studied. Somewhat later, it was pointed out by Zirkle et al. (1952) that the biological effectiveness depends on the spatial distribution of the energy imparted and the density of ionisations per unit path length of the ionising particles. Zirkle et al. coined the term ‘linear energy transfer (LET)’ to be used in radiobiology for the stopping power, i.e. the energy loss per unit path length of a charged particle. The concept was introduced in the 1950s, at a time when the deployment of nuclear weapons and nuclear reactors spurred research on the biological effects of artificial radioactivity. It had been noticed that those effects depended both on the type and [[energy spectrum]] of the radiation, and on the kind of living tissue. The first systematic experiments to determine the RBE were conducted in that decade.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}}

{{more citations needed|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox organization | name = Sahrawi Red Crescent
{{lang|ar|الهلال الأحمر الصحراوي}}
{{lang|es|Media Luna Roja Saharaui}}
{{lang|fr|Croissant Rouge Saharaoui}} | logo = Sahrawi Red Crescent 2.gif | logo_size = 250px | type = [[Aid agency]] | founded_date = November 26, 1975 | founder = | location = [[Sahrawi refugee camps]], [[Algeria]] | origins = [[Western Sahara]] | key_people = Yahia Bouhabini, President | area_served = Sahrawi Refugee Camps, [[Liberated Territories]] | product = Humanitarian Aid | focus = Helping refugees and providing assistance to disaster victims | method = | revenue = | endowment = Public and private donations | num_volunteers = | num_employees = | num_members = | subsid = | owner = [[Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic]] | Non-profit_slogan = | homepage = | dissolved = | footnotes = }} The '''Sahrawi Red Crescent Society''' is the part of the [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement]] for the country of [[Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic]] in Northern Africa. ==Foundation== The Sahrawi Red Crescent was formed by [[Sahrawi people|Sahrawi]] citizens on November 26, 1975, days after the joint Moroccan-Mauritanian invasion of former [[Spanish Sahara]] territory.{{cite web|title=Interview of the President of the Saharawi Red Crescent, Mr. Bouhabini Yahia|url=http://www.trianglegh.org/English/html/Information/Newsletter-avril-2009-gb/Art-3.html|publisher=Triangle Generation Humanitaire|accessdate=2012-10-30}}{{dead link|date=May 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} ==Mission== During the first years of the organization, its major task was to reunite families who were scattered through the desert due to the [[Western Sahara War]] removing them from the battlefields to the neighbouring Algerian Sahara, facing the aerial bombardments of the [[Moroccan Air Force]]. Later came the organization of the [[Sahrawi refugee camps|refugee camps]] at the Algerian desert. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Red Cross Red Crescent Movement}} [[Category:Red Cross and Red Crescent national societies]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1975]] [[Category:Sahrawi society]] [[Category:1975 establishments in Spanish Sahara]] [[Category:Medical and health organisations in the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic]]

A '''secondary hospital''', '''secondary referral center''' or a '''secondary care center''' refers to a hospital in the [[United States]] which can support licensed physicians in [[pediatrics]], [[obstetrics]], and [[gynecology]], [[general surgery]] and other supporting medical services.

{{Infobox temple |Name =Punaura Dham ,Janki Mandir |latin_name =Punaura Dham Janki Mandir |image = |imagesize = |caption = |location = punaura, sitamarhi | map_type = India Bihar | map_caption = Location in [[Bihar]] | coordinates = {{coord|25.2758121|86.5335154|display=inline,title}} |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = {{flag|India}} |subdivision_type1 = [[States and territories of India|State]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Bihar]] |subdivision_type2 = [[List of districts of India|District]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Sitamarhi District|Sitamarhi]] |alt = |deity = [[Sita]] |festivals = Janki Navami, Vivah Panchami, [[Durgapuja]] |architecture = vastu shastra |year_completed = Before 17th century AD |creator = Pragati Gaurav }}
The '''Punaura Dham, janki mandir''' is a Hindu pilgrimage site in [[Sitamarhi district]], in the [[India]]n state of [[Bihar]], which has an ancient [[Hindu]] temple. It is situated 5 km west of [[Sitamarhi]] town and a popular visitor's attraction.
'''Punaura Dham Janki Mandir ''' is one of the holiest Hindu temples dedicated to Goddess [[Sita]], located in [[Sitamarhi]], [[Bihar]], [[India]]. Million of pilgrims visit the temple every year and most visited religious shrine in [[North India]]. I
'''Punaura Dham''' is about 5 km west of [[Sitamarhi]]. Saint Pundrik's Ashram was situated here. '''Sita-Kund''' place is the honour of being the birthplace of Hindu Goddess, [[Sita]].
==Reaching there== The place can be easily reached from the [[Patna]] Airport, Bus Station, Patna Railway Station. The temple is just approx. 150 km from the Patna Junction Railway Station.<ref>{{cite web |title=Traveling to Sita Kund|url=http://www.india9.com/i9show/Sita-Kund-Temple-55481.htm|accessdate=2017-02-17}}</ref> Bus, taxis etc. are available at Patna, Gulzarbagh, Patliputra and Patna City railway stations.<ref>{{cite web |title=Sita-Kund History|url=http://bihardarpan.blogspot.com/2017/10/Sita-Kund.html|accessdate=2017-02-17}}</ref>
The place can be easily reached from the adjacent District's [[Muzaffarpur]], [[Darbhanga]], [[Madhubani district|Madhubani]] and [[East Champaran]].
The temple is just approx. 70 –80 km from the [[Muzaffarpur]] Railway Station/ Bus Station, [[Darbhanga]] Junction Railway Station/ Bus Station [[Madhubani, India|Madhubani]] Railway Station/ Bus Station and [[Motihari]] Railway Station/ Bus Station.
==Sitamarhi== This is the place where [[Sita]] was born, the main character of the epic Ramayana. The town is situated along the border of Nepal.
This district is often bereaved by natural calamities. One of the most devastating is excess flooding due to mis-management of the banks by both civilians and government officials. This town was almost completely destroyed by the earthquake of 1934.
[[Sitamarhi]] is a beautiful place. Sitamarhi is far away from Patna (approximately 140 km), lies the historical and mythologically-essayed town of Sitamarhi.
==Gallery== <gallery> File:Janaki kund, Sitamarhi, Bihar.jpg|Janaki kund, Sitamarhi File:Bagahi Math Sitamarhi, Bihar.jpg|Bagahi Math Sitamarhi File:Janakpur, Nepal.jpg|Janakpur File:Damamis.jpg|Damamis </gallery>
==See also== * [[Sitamarhi]] * [[Munger Fort]] * '''Sita Kund''', a spring of [[Surajkund hot spring]]

==External links== * [https://www.5-minutecrafts.com/search?updated-max=2018-10-31T11%3A50%3A00-07%3A00&max-results=6] Tarun patel, [[https://www.5-minutecrafts.com/]] website * [https://www.5-minutecrafts.com/2018/10/secrets-of-ramayan-ramayan-ke-rahasy.html]{{dead link|date=November 2018|bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} [[Sitamarhi district]] Official website https://www.5-minutecrafts.com/ *[https://www.5-minutecrafts.com/2018/10/blog-post28-kyo-hoti-hai-shivling-ki-pooja.html] *[http://www.google.co.in/maps/place/Punaura+Dham+-+Birth+Place+of+Goddess+Sita,+NH+104,+Punaura,+Sitamarhi,+Bihar+843302/@26.5864797,85.466754,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x39ecf1173c42d859:0x9a5fdbb839fa5de4?hl=en-IN/ googlemap - Punaura Dham] *[https://m.facebook.com/PunauraDham/?rf=606194936096183/ Facebook - Punaura Dham] *[https://m..youtube.com/watch?v=bmUVhTpw_3A&app=desktop/ YouTube -Punaura Dham ] *[https://m.facebook.com/Realigious-Place-Panthpakar-Dham-1058857130873093/ Facebook - Panthpakar Dham ] *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=higxb5JtG28&app=desktop/ YouTube - Panthpakar Dham ] *[https://m.facebook.com/?_rdr#!/profile.php?id=100011511077012&fref=ts/ Facebook-Anhari Dham ] *[http://www.bihartourism.gov.in/districts/Sitamarhi/Haleshwar%20Sthan.html/ website - Haleshwar Sthan ] *[http://sitamarhi.bih.nic.in/documents/tourism.htm/ website - Sitamarhi Tourism ] *[http://bstdc.bih.nic.in/Sitamarhi.htm/ website -Sitamarhi Hindu Temples ]

The '''Society of Pharmacovigilance, India''' (SoPI), is an Indian national non-profit scientific organisation, which aims at organizing training programmes and providing expertise in [[pharmacovigilance]] and enhance all aspects of the safe and proper use of [[medicines]]<ref>{{cite journal | doi= | last= Olsson| first=Sten| title= Pharmacovigilance training with focus on India | journal= Indian J Pharmacol |date=February 2008| volume=40| issue=Suppl| pages=S28–S30| pmid= 21369410|pmc=3038526}}</ref>
The [[International Society of Pharmacovigilance]] (ISoP) granted status of 'associated society' to Society of Pharmacovigilance India (SoPI). It is the second professional society in the world after ISoP.
The founder of SoPI is [[KC Singhal]].
==Annual Events== * 14th Annual Conference of SoPI (SoPICON 2014), Aligarh, India [http://sopicon-2014.blogspot.in/]
==Office Bearers== * [[KC Singhal]] (Patron) * [[Barna Ganguly]] (President) * [[Syed Ziaur Rahman]] (General Secretary)
==See also== *[[Uppsala Monitoring Centre]] (WHO) *[[Council for International Organizations of Medical Sciences]] *[[EudraVigilance]] *[[Virtue Insight]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *Official Website of SoPI [http://sopi.net.in Society of Pharmacovigilance, India] *www.virtueinsight.com]
[[Category:Pharmaceuticals policy]] {{pharmacy-stub}}

{{short description|Medical device for investigating body orifices by direct vision}} [[File:Spéculum en plastique.jpg|thumb|250px|The disposable bivalved plastic vaginal speculum is used in office gynecology]]
A '''speculum''' (Latin for "mirror"; plural '''specula''' or speculums) is a medical tool for investigating body [[orifices]], with a form dependent on the orifice for which it is designed. In old texts, the speculum may also be referred to as a '''diopter''' or '''dioptra'''.<ref>"diopter" in ''The Compact Edition of the Oxford English Dictionary'', Oxford University Press, 1971</ref> Like an [[endoscope]], a speculum allows a view inside the body; endoscopes, however, tend to have [[optics]] while a speculum is intended for direct vision.
==History== [[File:5 Speculum, 14th 15th and 16th century. Wellcome M0008374.jpg|thumb|right|14th, 15th and 16th century specula]] Vaginal and anal specula were used by the [[Ancient Greece|ancient Greeks]] and [[Ancient Rome|Romans]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hsl.virginia.edu/historical/artifacts/roman_surgical/ |author=Univ. of Virginia |title=Surgical Instruments from Ancient Rome (with pictures) |accessdate=2009-06-12}}</ref> and speculum [[Artifact (archaeology)|artifacts]] have been found in [[Pompeii]].<ref>{{cite book|title = History of Medicine|author = [[Cecilia Mettler]]|publisher = The Blakiston Co (1947)}}</ref> A vaginal speculum, developed by [[J. Marion Sims]], consists of a hollow cylinder with a rounded end that is divided into two hinged parts, somewhat like the [[beak]] of a duck. The speculum is inserted into the vagina to dilate it for examination of the [[vagina]] and [[cervix]].
==Construction== Specula were formerly made of [[stainless steel]], and sterilized after use. However, many, especially those used in emergency departments and doctor's offices, are now made of plastic, and are disposable, single-use items. Those used in surgical suites are still commonly made of metal.
==Types== [[File:Glasspekula.jpg|right|thumb|upright|Two cylindrical-shaped glass specula]]
Specula come in a variety of shapes based on their purpose, and a variety of sizes;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.m-e-dical.com/english/vs.htm|title=Comparison chart of speculum types, with line images|accessdate=2014-05-03}}</ref> in any case the cylinder or blade(s) of the instrument allow the operator a direct vision of the area of interest and the possibility to introduce instruments for further interventions such as a biopsy.
===Vaginal use===
The best-known speculum is the bivalved vaginal speculum; the two blades are hinged and are "closed" when the speculum is inserted to facilitate its entry and "opened" in its final position where they can be arrested by a screw mechanism, so that the operator is freed from keeping the blades apart.
A cylindrical-shaped speculum, introduced in 2001, the dilating vaginal speculum (also known as the Veda-scope<ref>{{cite journal|pmid=15089838|year=2004|author1=Longmore|first1=P. G.|title=Veda-scope: More comfortable than the bivalve speculum and cytologically equivalent|journal=The Australian and New Zealand Journal of Obstetrics and Gynaecology|volume=44|issue=2|pages=140–5|doi=10.1111/j.1479-828X.2004.00180.x}}</ref>) invented by Clemens van der Weegen,<ref>van der Weegen, Clemens (2000) "Vaginal speculum with seal" {{US Patent|6719687}}</ref> inflates the vagina with filtered air.<ref>{{cite journal|pmid=11787909|year=2001|author1=Thomas|first1=A|title=A randomised controlled trial comparing a dilating vaginal speculum with a conventional bivalve speculum|journal=The Australian & New Zealand journal of obstetrics & gynaecology|volume=41|issue=4|pages=379–86|last2=Weisberg|first2=E|last3=Lieberman|first3=D|last4=Fraser|first4=I. S.}}</ref> (see diagram) The device has two main functions: a) to take a normal Pap smear with a cervical brush or a cytology brush; and b) as an internal [[colposcope]] so that the operator can pivot the Veda-scope to view any part of the vagina barrel and cervix facilitated by an internal light source that can illuminate the vaginal wall and cervix with multi-coloured light filters, which can detect pre-cancerous cells with the aid of [[acetic acid]] solution and [[iodine]] solution. It also has a facility to attach a digital camera for viewing and recording.<ref>[http://pacificei.com/how_work.html How it works]. pacificei.com</ref> [[File:Dilating vaginal speculum inflating vagina and light illuminating.jpg|right|thumb|Dilating vaginal speculum inflating vagina and light illuminating (cervical brush inserts through top inlet)]]
A specialized form of vaginal speculum is the weighted speculum, which consists of a broad half tube which is bent at about a 90 degree angle, with the channel of the tube on the exterior side of the angle. One end of the tube has a roughly spherical metal weight surrounding the channel of the speculum. A weighted speculum is placed in the vagina during vaginal [[surgery]] with the patient in the [[lithotomy position]]. The weight holds the speculum in place and frees the surgeon's hands for other tasks. A vaginal speculum is also used in fertility treatments, particularly artificial insemination, and allows the vaginal cavity to be opened and observed thereby facilitating the deposit of semen into the vagina.
;Cylindrical shape * Ferguson * Glass speculum * Veda-scope (dilating vaginal speculum)
;One blade [[File:Sims.Speculum.jpg|right|thumb|upright|The single-bladed Sims speculum is still in use today.]] {| |- | valign="top"| * Auvard * Breisky * Doyen * Eastman * Jackson * Kallmorgen * Kristeller | valign="top"| * Landau * Martin * Mathieu * Polansky * Samuel * Scherbak * Sims * Weissbarth |}
;Two blades (bivalved) [[File:Speculum of Polansky.jpg|thumb|Medical instrument]] [[File:Speculum en métal.jpg|thumb|right|upright|Duckbill shape of a two-bladed speculum]] {| |- | valign="top"| * Collin * Cusco * DeVilbiss * Grave | valign="top"| * Pederson * Semm * Seyffert * Trelat * Winterton |}
;Three blades {| |- | valign="top"| * Guttmann * Nott | valign="top"| * O´Sullivan-O´Connor * Polansky (veterinary use) |}
===Rectal use=== Vaginal specula are also used for [[anus|anal]] surgery, although several other forms of anal specula exist. One form, the [[Anoscopy|anoscope]], resembles a tube that has a removable [[bullet]]-shaped insert. When the anoscope is inserted into the anus, the insert dilates the anus to the diameter of the tube. The insert is then removed, leaving the tube to allow examination of the lower rectum and anus.
This style of anal speculum is one of the oldest designs for surgical instruments still in use, with examples dating back many centuries. The [[Sigmoidoscopy|sigmoidoscope]] can be further advanced into the lower intestinal tract and requires an endoscopic set-up.
;Tubal shape * Aniscope
;One blade * Czerny
;Two blades {| |- | valign="top"| * Barr * Bodenhammer * Killian * Pratt | valign="top"| * Ricord * Roschke * Sims * Smith-Buie |} ;Three blades * Alan Park * Cook * Mathieu
===Nasal use=== [[human nose|Nasal]] specula have two relatively flat blades with handle. The instrument is hinged so that when the handles are squeezed together the blades spread laterally, allowing examination. {| |- | valign="top"| * Killian * Vienna | valign="top"| * Voltolini * Yankauer |}
Additionally, the [[Johann_Ludwig_Wilhelm_Thudichum|Thudichum]] nasal speculum is commonly used in the outpatient examination of the nose.
===Aural use=== [[File:Aural Speculum ENT Instrument Medical.jpg|right|thumb|Ear specula are funnel-shaped.]] [[Ear]] or aural specula resemble a [[funnel]], and come in a variety of sizes. {| |- | valign="top"| * Aural speculum | valign="top"| |}
===Oral use=== In veterinary medicine, a McPherson Speculum can be used for oral examination. The speculum helps keep the mouth open during the exam and helps avoid biting injuries.
==BDSM== Speculum is used for ''Speculum Play'' under [[BDSM]] for spreading the [[vagina]] or the [[anus]].<ref>[https://www.kinkly.com/definition/14516/speculum-play Speculum Play by www.kinkly.com]</ref>
==See also== * {{annotated link|Endoscope}} * {{annotated link|Colposcopy|Colposcope}} * {{annotated link|Vaginal dilator}}
==References== {{commons category|speculums}} {{reflist}} {{Surgical instruments}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Speculum (Medical)}} [[Category:Medical equipment]] [[Category:Gynaecology]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox television |show_name = The Bonnie Prudden Show |image = |show_name_2 = |caption = |genre = talk show, exercise |creator = |developer = |writer = |director = |creative_director = |presenter = |starring = [[Bonnie Prudden]] |judges = |voices = |narrated = |theme_music_composer = |opentheme = |endtheme = |composer = |country = Canada |language = English |channel = [[CBC Television]] |first_run = |first_aired = 15 November 1965 |last_aired = 11 June 1968 |num_seasons = 2 |num_episodes = 195 |status = |list_episodes = |executive_producer = |producer = |editor = |location = |cinematography = |camera = |runtime = |company = Crescendo Productions |distributor = [[MGM Television|Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Television]] |picture_format = |audio_format = |preceded_by = |followed_by = |related = |website = |production_website = }} {{use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} '''''The Bonnie Prudden Show''''' is a [[Television in Canada|Canadian]] talk show and exercise television series which aired on [[CBC Television]] from 1965 to 1970.
==Premise== Fitness expert [[Bonnie Prudden]] combined interview and exercise segments during this series. Subjects included aging, astrology, finance, health and travel. Her guests were from internationally and culturally diverse backgrounds.<ref name=SSP27Oct1967 />
Some episodes, especially in the 1967-68 season, were produced on location in such regions as Asia and Australia.<ref name=CCF>{{cite web | url=http://www.broadcasting-history.ca/programming/television/bonnie-prudden-show | first=John | last=Corcelli | date=June 2005 | title=The Bonnie Prudden Show | publisher=Canadian Communications Foundation | accessdate=6 December 2017 }}</ref>
Episodes were produced in Toronto by Crescendo Productions and Taylor-Roffman Productions Ltd. and broadcast by CBC Television and in US syndication.<ref name=SSP27Oct1967 /><ref>{{cite web | url=http://collectionscanada.gc.ca/pam_archives/index.php?fuseaction=genitem.displayItem&rec_nbr=85768 | title=Archives Search | publisher=Library and Archives Canada | accessdate=3 May 2012 }}</ref>
==Scheduling== This half-hour series was broadcast on CBC weekdays at 4:00 p.m. in its first season for 65 episodes from 15 November 1965 to 15 February 1966.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.crtc.gc.ca/canrec/1960-69.txt | title=List of CRTC Canadian Program Recognition Numbers | date=8 November 2005 | publisher=Canadian Radio-Television and Telecommunications Commission | accessdate=3 May 2012}}</ref> After skipping new production for 1966-67, other than some limited morning rebroadcasts in early 1967, its final season of 130 programmes in 1967-68 was broadcast from 30 October 1967 to 11 June 1968.<ref name=SSP27Oct1967>{{cite news | url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=wi9gAAAAIBAJ&pg=4718%2C4349114 | title=Fitness specialist filmed on international locations | newspaper=Saskatoon Star-Phoenix | page=10 | date=27 October 1967 | accessdate=3 May 2012 }}</ref>
Repeats were broadcast on CBC Television until September 1970.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{cite web | url=http://www.film.queensu.ca/CBC/B.html | first=Blaine | last=Allan | title=The Bonnie Prudden Show | publisher=[[Queen's University]] | year=1996 | accessdate=7 May 2010 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150911235410/http://www.film.queensu.ca/CBC/B.html | archivedate=11 September 2015 | df=dmy-all }}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bonnie Prudden Show}} [[Category:CBC Television shows]] [[Category:1965 Canadian television series debuts]] [[Category:1967 Canadian television series endings]] [[Category:Canadian television talk shows]] [[Category:Exercise television programs]] [[Category:Television series produced in Toronto]]

The '''tobacco industry of Argentina''' produced 157,294 tonnes of [[tobacco]] in the 2003–2004 harvest, most of which (93,327 tonnes) was exported. The planted area was 831.75 km², of which 776 were harvested.
The tobacco industry is dominated by two transnational companies: Massalin Particulares S.A. (a subsidiary of [[Philip Morris International]], which sells the [[Marlboro (cigarette)|Marlboro]] brand, and which in turn is associated with Tabacos Norte S.A.) and Nobleza Piccardo (a subsidiary of [[British American Tobacco]], which sells international brands such as [[Lucky Strike]], [[Viceroy (cigarette)|Viceroy]] and [[Camel (cigarette)|Camel]], as well as national ones like Jockey and Derby).
Tobacco producers are concentrated in the north of the country. The provinces of [[Jujuy Province|Jujuy]] and [[Salta Province|Salta]] (in the [[Argentine Northwest|north-west]]), and [[Misiones Province|Misiones]] (in the north-eastern [[Mesopotamia, Argentina|Mesopotamia]]), are the leading ones, with over 45,000 tonnes/year each. The other tobacco-producing provinces are [[Tucumán Province|Tucumán]], [[Corrientes Province|Corrientes]], [[Chaco Province|Chaco]] and [[Catamarca Province|Catamarca]].
Tobacco plays an important role in the economy of the producing areas, which are comparatively poor provinces. The Argentine tobacco industry employs 500,000 people, about half of them directly involved in the planting and harvesting, only about 2% in the manufacturing of the derived products, and the rest in distribution and sales. Therefore, despite the fact that the consequences of smoking are a major health issue in [[Argentina]], the national government supports the producers by means of a Tobacco Special Fund (''Fondo Especial del Tabaco'', FET), which consists in a [[subsidy]] plus easier access to [[credit (finance)|credit]] in order to modernize the industry.
== Labor Practices == An important number of Argentina's tobacco industry employees are mostly underage workers. The TVPRA ''[[List of Goods Produced by Child Labor or Forced Labor]]''<ref>[http://www.dol.gov/ilab/reports/child-labor/list-of-goods/ List of Goods Produced by Child Labor or Forced Labor]</ref> published in December 2014 by the [[Bureau of International Labor Affairs]] underlines the existence of such practices in Argentina. The [[United States Department of Labor]] reported that despite the implementation of educational programs, "children in Argentina continue to engage in child labor in agriculture and the worst forms of child labor..."<ref>[http://www.dol.gov/ilab/reports/child-labor/argentina.htm 2013 Findings on the Worst Forms of Child Labor - Argentina - ]</ref>
==See also== * [[Smoking in Argentina]] * [[Agriculture in Argentina]]
==References== {{reflist}} {{refbegin}} * ''Dirección Nacional de Producción y Economía Agropecuaria y Forestal - Área Tabaco.'' [http://www.sagpya.mecon.gov.ar/scripts/tab_esti.idc Production and export of tobacco] and [http://www.sagpya.mecon.gov.ar/scripts/tab_pcia.idc Production of tobacco by province]. * {{cite journal|author1=M. G. Rozada |author2=G. Sánchez |author3=M. Angueira |author4=F. J. Bartolomé Verra |year=2002|url=http://www.msal.gov.ar/htm/site_tabaco/pdf/Estudio%20econometrico%202002%5B1%5D%5B1%5D.final.pdf| format=PDF|title=Análisis económico del consumo de tabaco en Argentina|accessdate=2006-06-26}} * ComunicaRSE. [http://www.comunicarseweb.com.ar/directorio/massalin.html Massalin Particulares S.A.] * [http://www.noblezapiccardo.com/ Nobleza Piccardo] - Company website. {{refend}}
{{Economy of Argentina}}
[[Category:Tobacco in Argentina]] [[Category:Agriculture in Argentina]] [[Category:Tobacco industry by country]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Multiple issues|section=| {{lead too short|date=August 2016}} {{Globalise|date=January 2018}} }} [[File:Vapor-specific shops of Lincoln (April 2014), location 7 of 8.jpg|right|thumb|A vape shop in [[Lincoln, Nebraska]], US.<ref name=dailynebraskan2014/>|alt=A vape shop in Lincoln, Nebraska, US.]] A '''vape shop''' is a [[retail store]] or website specializing in the selling of [[electronic cigarette]] products.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Sussman|first1=Steve|last2=Garcia|first2=Robert|last3=Cruz|first3=Tess|last4=Baezconde-Garbanati|first4=Lourdes|last5=Pentz|first5=Mary|last6=Unger|first6=Jennifer B|title=Consumers’ perceptions of vape shops in Southern California: an analysis of online Yelp reviews|journal=Tobacco Induced Diseases|volume=12|issue=1|year=2014|pages=22|issn=1617-9625|doi=10.1186/s12971-014-0022-7|pmid=25484852|pmc=4258055}}</ref>
==Store== [[File:Vaping (9832376464).jpg|right|thumb|Interior view of a vape shop in the US.|alt=Interior view of a vape shop in the US.]] [[File:Vape on! (14578840025).jpg|thumb|right|150px|E-cigarette retailer marketing sign.|alt=E-cigarette retailer marketing sign that says vape on.]] [[Electronic cigarette|E-cigarettes]] products are mainly available online or in dedicated "vape" storefronts.<ref name=Esterl2014>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/vaporizers-are-the-new-draw-in-e-cigarettes-1401378596|title='Vaporizers' Are the New Draw in E-Cigarettes|author=Mike Esterl|work=[[The Wall Street Journal]]|date=29 May 2014}}</ref> They are also available at grocery stores,<ref name=LeeKim2015>{{cite journal|last1=Lee|first1=Youn Ok|last2=Kim|first2=Annice E|title='Vape shops' and 'E-Cigarette lounges' open across the USA to promote ENDS|journal=Tobacco Control|volume=24|issue=4|year=2015|pages=410–412|issn=0964-4563|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2013-051437|pmid=24727649}}</ref> conventional retailers,<ref name=Hahn2015/> mass retailers,<ref name=HuangTauras2014>{{cite journal|last1=Huang|first1=Jidong|last2=Tauras|first2=John|last3=Chaloupka|first3=Frank J|title=The impact of price and tobacco control policies on the demand for electronic nicotine delivery systems|journal=Tobacco Control|volume=23|issue=suppl 3|year=2014|pages=iii41–iii47|issn=0964-4563|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2013-051515|pmc=4145658|pmid=24935898}}</ref> tobacco retailers,<ref name=Hahn2015>{{cite journal|last1=Hahn|first1=Ellen J.|last2=Begley|first2=Kathy|last3=Gokun|first3=Yevgeniya|last4=Johnson|first4=Andrew O.|last5=Mundy|first5=Monica E.|last6=Rayens|first6=Mary Kay|title=Electronic Cigarette Retail Outlets and Proximity to Schools|journal=American Journal of Health Promotion|volume=29|issue=6|year=2015|pages=380–383|issn=0890-1171|doi=10.4278/ajhp.130627-ARB-335|pmid=24968182}}</ref> convenience stores,<ref name=HuangTauras2014/> gas stations, drug stores,<ref name=Lee2015>{{cite journal|last1=Lee|first1=Andrew H. Y.|last2=Stater|first2=Brian J.|last3=Close|first3=Lanny|last4=Rahmati|first4=Rahmatullah|title=Are e-cigarettes effective in smoking cessation?|journal=The Laryngoscope|volume=125|issue=4|year=2015|pages=785–787|issn=0023-852X|doi=10.1002/lary.24954|pmid=25387447}}</ref> and shopping malls.<ref name=Sunnucks2014>{{cite journal|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/news/2014/01/27/some-phoenix-landlords-hesitant-to.html|author=Mike Sunnucks|title=Some Phoenix landlords hesitant to lease space to electronic cigarette shops|journal=Phoenix Business Journal|date=27 January 2014}}</ref> A vape shop offers a range of e-cigarette products.<ref name=Jones2015/> The majority of vape shops do not sell e-cigarette products that are from "[[Big Tobacco]]" companies.<ref name=SussmanBaezconde-Garbanati2015/> Vape shops can offer a greater selection of e-cigarettes than conventional retailers.<ref name=KimLoomis2016>{{cite journal|last1=Kim|first1=Annice E|last2=Loomis|first2=Brett|last3=Rhodes|first3=Bryan|last4=Eggers|first4=Matthew E|last5=Liedtke|first5=Christopher|last6=Porter|first6=Lauren|title=Identifying e-cigarette vape stores: description of an online search methodology|journal=Tobacco Control|volume=25|issue=e1|year=2016|pages=e19–e23|issn=0964-4563|doi=10.1136/tobaccocontrol-2015-052270|pmid=26205913}}</ref> While vape shops offer mostly [[construction of electronic cigarettes|reusable e-cigarettes]], cig-a-likes are mostly available at convenience stores.<ref name=Hunt2015>{{cite news | url=http://mountainx.com/news/foggy-frontiers-the-rise-of-the-vapor-industry-in-wnc/|title=Foggy frontiers: The rise of the vapor industry in WNC|work=[[Mountain Xpress]]|date=16 July 2015}}</ref>
Vape shops typically offer a diverse selection of [[e-liquids]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/e-cigarette-industry-booming-in-saskatchewan-1.2735841|title=E-cigarette industry booming in Saskatchewan|publisher=[[CBC News]]|date=14 August 2014}}</ref> Vape shops can buy e-liquids containing 100 mg/mL and dilute them according to the patron's preference.<ref name=KaisarPrasad2016>{{cite journal|last1=Kaisar|first1=Mohammad Abul|last2=Prasad|first2=Shikha|last3=Liles|first3=Tylor|last4=Cucullo|first4=Luca|title=A Decade of e-Cigarettes: Limited Research & Unresolved Safety Concerns|journal=Toxicology|year=2016|issn=0300-483X|doi=10.1016/j.tox.2016.07.020|pmid=27477296|volume=365|pages=67–75}}</ref> [[Flavor#Flavorants or flavorings|Flavors]] such as chocolate, caramel, mint, menthol, coffee, cherry, and apple can be added to the liquid nicotine.<ref name=KaisarPrasad2016/> Vape shops may carry vaping magazines and may offer accessories such as clothing, bags and wooden cases for the e-liquid.<ref name=Jones2015>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/magazine-32094431|title=California vaping: The new subculture|author=Owen Bennett Jones|publisher=[[BBC News Online]]|date=6 April 2015}}</ref> Vape shops host music concerts at night.<ref name=Neely2016>{{cite news|url=http://thedmonline.com/vape-music-wall-oxfords-newest-music-venue/|title=Vape, music and The Wall: Oxford’s newest music venue|author=Alexis Neely|work=[[The Daily Mississippian]]|date=25 August 2015}}</ref> Vape shops are increasing in popularity.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.keyt.com/news/sb-county-considers-ecig-ban-in-public-places/34028248|title=SB County Considers E-Cig Ban in Public Places|author=Owen Bennett Jones|publisher=NPG of California|date=6 July 2015}}</ref> Many e-cigarette companies have proposed to retailers the idea to convert part of their current location into a mini vape shop.<ref name=Haar-2014/>
Vape shops are mainly small, independent businesses.<ref name=Mincer2015>{{cite news|url=https://news.yahoo.com/rise-u-vape-shops-owners-eye-marijuana-market-050555483--finance.html;_ylt=AwrTceJaLN1VcIQAN2knnIlQ;_ylu=X3oDMTByNWU4cGh1BGNvbG8DZ3ExBHBvcwMxBHZ0aWQDBHNlYwNzYw--|title=In rise of U.S. vape shops, owners eye new marijuana market|author=Jilian Mincer|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=29 July 2015}}</ref> Vape shops are usually interested in a location between 1,200 and 1,500 square feet.<ref name=Sunnucks2014/> They vary in design and product selection.<ref name=Jones2015/> Some look like bars.<ref name=Jones2015/> Some have lounges where people can drink a beverage as they vape.<ref name=Jones2015/> Some vape shops have a vape bar where patrons can test out different e-liquids and socialize.<ref name=dailynebraskan2014>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailynebraskan.com/news/generation-v-e-cigarettes-and-vape-bar-aims-to-convert/article_f79f2130-9466-11e3-b3d8-0017a43b2370.html|title=Generation V E-Cigarettes and Vape Bar aims to convert smokers to e-cigarettes|work=[[Daily Nebraskan]]|date=13 February 2014}}</ref> Vape shop customers visit their local vape shop for personalized e-cigarette advice.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Polosa|first1=Riccardo|last2=Caponnetto|first2=Pasquale|last3=Cibella|first3=Fabio|last4=Le-Houezec|first4=Jacques|title=Quit and Smoking Reduction Rates in Vape Shop Consumers: A Prospective 12-Month Survey|journal=International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health|volume=12|issue=4|year=2015|pages=3428–3438|issn=1660-4601|doi=10.3390/ijerph120403428|pmid=25811767|pmc=4410194}}</ref> Vape shop retail workers may show potential customers how to use different e-cigarettes and how to fill the devices with e-liquid.<ref name=dailynebraskan2014/> A "vapologist" may give advise to potential customers to choosing an e-liquid.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/01/12/nyregion/e-cigarette-shops-open-even-as-city-cracks-down.html|title=E-Cigarette Shops Open Even as City Cracks Down|work=[[The New York Times]]|author=Daniel Krieger|date=9 January 2014}}</ref> Patrons are permitted to vape in most vape shops.<ref name=SussmanAllem2016>{{cite journal|last1=Sussman|first1=Steve|last2=Allem|first2=Jon-Patrick|last3=Garcia|first3=Jocelyn|last4=Unger|first4=Jennifer B.|last5=Cruz|first5=Tess Boley|last6=Garcia|first6=Robert|last7=Baezconde-Garbanati|first7=Lourdes|title=Who walks into vape shops in Southern California?: a naturalistic observation of customers|journal=Tobacco Induced Diseases|volume=14|issue=1|year=2016|issn=1617-9625|doi=10.1186/s12971-016-0082-y|pmc=4880826|pmid=27231480}}</ref> "[[Cloud-chasing (electronic cigarette)|Cloud-chasing]]", the activity of blowing the largest clouds of vapor, is becoming a routine event at some vape shops.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/05/01/us-ecigarettes-teens-tricks-insight-idUSKBN0NM49020150501|title=As youth vaping rises, teens cite the allure of tricks|author=Jilian Mincer|publisher=[[Reuters]]|date=1 May 2015}}</ref>
Some vape shop owners choose not to sell vaping products to minors.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.kshb.com/news/local-news/teens-using-e-cigarettes-triples-few-in-metro-monitoring-to-see-how-theyre-getting-them|title=Number of teens using e-cigarettes triples; few in metro monitoring to see how they're getting them|author=Brendaliss Gonzalez|publisher=[[E. W. Scripps Company]]|date=3 July 2015}}</ref> Vapor store owners use the internet to get information e-cigarettes.<ref name=CheneyGowin2016/> Vape shop owners generally believe vaping is a habit.<ref name=CheneyGowin2016>{{cite journal|last1=Cheney|first1=Marshall K.|last2=Gowin|first2=Mary|last3=Wann|first3=Taylor Franklin|title=Vapor Store Owner Beliefs and Messages to Customers|journal=Nicotine & Tobacco Research|volume=18|issue=5|year=2016|pages=694–699|issn=1462-2203|doi=10.1093/ntr/ntv129|pmid=26113622}}</ref> It has been reported that many vape shop owners do not know all of the substances contained in e-liquids.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rocklandtimes.com/2016/07/07/vape-culture-grows-still-nobody-knows/|title=Vape Culture Grows, Still Nobody Knows|author=dskriloff|publisher=Rockland County Times|date=7 July 2016}}</ref>
{{clear}}
==Prevalence== In 2013, online [[search engine]] searches on vape shops surpassed searches on e-cigarettes.<ref name=Haar-2014>{{cite news|author= Melissa Vonder Haar|title=A Case of the Vapors|url=http://www.cspdailynews.com/sites/default/files/magazine-files/F1_TOBSUP_2014.pdf|work=Convenience Store News|year=2014}}</ref> The markup of e-cigarettes as high as 200–400% may play a role in the prevalence of vape shops.<ref name=SussmanBaezconde-Garbanati2015>{{cite journal|last1=Sussman|first1=S.|last2=Baezconde-Garbanati|first2=L.|last3=Garcia|first3=R.|last4=Barker|first4=D. C.|last5=Samet|first5=J. M.|last6=Leventhal|first6=A.|last7=Unger|first7=J. B.|title=Commentary: Forces That Drive the Vape Shop Industry and Implications for the Health Professions|journal=Evaluation & the Health Professions|year=2015|issn=0163-2787|doi=10.1177/0163278715586295|pmid=25967071|volume=39|pmc=5021181|pages=379–88}}</ref> In 2014, the Smoke-Free Alternatives Trade Association estimated that there were 35,000 vape shops in the US, more than triple the number a year earlier.<ref name=EsterlAug2014>{{cite news|last1=Esterl|first1=Mike|title=Big Tobacco's E-Cigarette Push Gets a Reality Check|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/big-tobaccos-e-cig-push-gets-a-reality-check-1409078319|work=The Wall Street Journal|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> There are numerous vape shops in Canada.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.standard-freeholder.com/2016/06/10/vape-depot-opens-cornwall-location|title=Vape Depot opens Cornwall location|author=Todd Hambleton|work=Cornwall Standard Freeholder|date=10 June 2016}}</ref> In 2015, there were about 8,000 vape shops in the UK.<ref name=TheEconomicVoice2015>{{cite news|url=http://www.economicvoice.com/will-2016-be-the-year-that-the-high-street-vape-shop-runs-out-of-puff/|title=Will 2016 be the year that the high street vape shop runs out of puff?|publisher=The Economic Voice Ltd|date=15 December 2015}}</ref> In December 2015, there were 2,400 vape shops in France, 400 fewer than in March of the same year.<ref name=Lastennet2016/> Industry organization Fivape said the reduction was due to consolidation, not to reduced demand.<ref name=Lastennet2016>{{cite news|last1=Lastennet|first1=Vincent|title=Cigarettes électroniques. Le marché de la vape en deux cartes|url=http://www.letelegramme.fr/bretagne/cigarettes-electroniques-le-marche-de-la-vape-en-deux-cartes-07-02-2016-10949003.php|work=Le Télégramme|date=7 February 2016}}</ref>
==Regulations== Effective from 8 August 2016, under the [[Food and Drug Administration]] (FDA) rules, a vape shop that mixes or prepares e-liquids, or makes or modifies any kind of e-cigarettes, is regulated as a tobacco product manufacturer.<ref name=FDA-2016>{{cite web|title=Vaporizers, E-Cigarettes, and other Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (ENDS)|url=http://www.fda.gov/TobaccoProducts/Labeling/ProductsIngredientsComponents/ucm456610.htm|publisher=US Department of Health and Human Services|agency=US Food and Drug Administration|date=7 August 2016}}</ref> Vape shops cannot hand out free samples to patrons or sell to individuals under 18 years of age.<ref name=Madhani2016/> Retailers are required to ask for photo ID from patrons who look to be under 27 years of age.<ref name=Madhani2016>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2016/08/07/e-cigarette-regulations-set-go-into-effect/88362926/|title=It's about to get a lot harder for minors to vape|author=Aamer Madhani|publisher=[[USA Today]]|date=8 August 2016}}</ref>
In May 2016 the FDA used its authority under the [[Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act]] to deem e-cigarette devices and e-liquids to be tobacco products, which meant it intended to regulate the marketing, labelling, and manufacture of devices and liquids; vape shops that mix e-liquids or make or modify devices were considered manufacturing sites that needed to register with FDA and comply with [[good manufacturing practice]] regulation.<ref name=FDA2016>{{cite journal|title=Deeming Tobacco Products To Be Subject to the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, as Amended by the Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act; Restrictions on the Sale and Distribution of Tobacco Products and Required Warning Statements for Tobacco Products|url=https://www.federalregister.gov/articles/2016/05/10/2016-10685/deeming-tobacco-products-to-be-subject-to-the-federal-food-drug-and-cosmetic-act-as-amended-by-the|journal=Federal Register|publisher=Food and Drug Administration|page=234|date=10 May 2016}}</ref> Small vape shop businesses are concerned about the FDA regulations.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10130211234592774869404581088451777513530|title=FDA Cloud Hangs Over Vape Shops|author=Tripp Mickle|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|date=7 July 2015}}</ref> Vape shop owners in the US are concerned about the costs of adhering to the proposed FDA regulations.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.newsinferno.com/new-regulations-for-liquid-nicotine-expected-to-have-major-impact-on-vape-shops/|title=New Regulations for Liquid Nicotine Expected to Have Major Impact on Vape Shops|author=F.A. Kelley|publisher=NewsInferno|date=8 July 2015}}</ref> Some vape shop owners believe the proposed FDA rules might put them out of business.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.wyff4.com/news/fda-proposes-strict-regulations-for-vaping/34135730|title=FDA proposes strict regulations for vaping |author=Gabrielle Komorowski|publisher=[[WYFF]]|date=13 July 2015}}</ref> On 5 May 2016, the FDA announced that all tobacco products will be regulated, including e-cigarettes, which require vape shops to register as tobacco companies.<ref name=NewsChannel10-2016>{{cite news|url=http://www.newschannel10.com/story/32009771/new-fda-regulations-smoke-out-local-vape-shop-owners|title=New FDA regulations smoke out local vape shop owners|publisher=News Channel 10|date=16 May 2016}}</ref> The FDA acknowledged that many vape shops will go out of business, but they also state many will stay open, despite hefty costs.<ref name=NewsChannel4-2016>{{cite news|url=http://kfor.com/2016/05/05/fda-unveils-new-regulations-on-tobacco-vaping-industry/|title=FDA unveils new regulations on tobacco, vaping industry|authors=KFOR-TV & K. Querry, CNN Wire|publisher=News Channel 4|date=16 May 2016}}</ref> Part of the new law requires products to state [[nicotine]] is addictive.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.indystar.com/story/news/2016/05/08/indiana-vape-shop-owners-say-new-fda-rule-crush-industry/84036264/|title=Indiana vape shop owners say new FDA rule will crush industry|author=Shari Rudavsky|work=[[The Indianapolis Star]]|date=9 May 2016}}</ref> Some vape shop owners in the US believe a [[list of vaping bans in the United States|ban on public vaping]] might put some vape shops out of business because taste-testing would be prohibited.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/snohomish-county-considers-ban-on-e-cigarettes-in-public/|title=Snohomish County considers ban on e-cigarettes in public|publisher=[[The Seattle Times Company]]|agency=[[Associated Press]]|date=11 July 2015}}</ref>
The revised Tobacco Products Directive European legislation will regulate the sale and marketing of e-cigarettes.<ref name=TheEconomicVoice2015/> Small business owners are concerned that the new regulation will make e-cigarettes less interesting to consumers and that this means a downturn of their business.<ref name=TheEconomicVoice2015/> In late November 2015, Bill 44 was passed by the [[National Assembly of Quebec|National Assembly]], which regulates e-cigarettes as tobacco products.<ref name=CBCNEWS2016>{{cite news|title=Vape store owners argue new Quebec law infringes on freedom of speech|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/ecigarette-vaping-bill-44-charter-of-rights-1.3465564|publisher=[[CBC News]]|date=26 February 2016}}</ref> It bans using e-cigarettes in vape shops, bans indoor displays and advertising, and bans sales on their websites.<ref>{{cite news|title=Canadian vaping industry challenging Quebec law|url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/health/canadian-vaping-industry-challenging-quebec-law-1.2857655|publisher=[[CTV News]]|agency=[[The Canadian Press]]|date=13 April 2016}}</ref>
==Trade show== [[File:Electronic Cigarette Convention Anaheim CA 2013 (10452741094).jpg|right|thumb|A bird's-eye view of an e-cigarette convention in the US.|alt=A bird's-eye view of an e-cigarette convention in the US.]] Vape trade shows have an array of product vendors, seminars, social interactions with other vapers, parties, gifts, vaping contests, and other activities.<ref name=Williams2015/> By 2015, the number of vaping trade show organizations arranging vape trade shows had grown to 41.<ref name=Williams2015/> This includes 90 trade shows, with 6 set for 2016 in 8 countries.<ref name=Williams2015/> Vape shows were organized in 26 US states.<ref name=Williams2015/> They ranged from smaller local shows to large shows jumping around among cities.<ref name=Williams2015/> Most vape show organizations are in the US.<ref name=Williams2015/> Others are in Belgium, Canada, China, France, Germany, South Africa, and the United Kingdom.<ref name=Williams2015/> Vape shows are free to attend or have an entrance fee that cost from [[United States dollar|$]]10 to $25.<ref name=Williams2015/> In 2014, vaping contests at vape trade shows such as cloud-chasing were rare.<ref name=Williams2015/> By 2015, close to 50% of vaping trade show organizations promoted contests such as cloud-chasing.<ref name=Williams2015/> Vaping at the shows is permitted.<ref name=Williams2015/> In July 2015, a New Jersey vape trade show was fined for breaching the state’s 2010 indoor [[smoke-free law]], which bans vaping indoors.<ref name=Williams2015/> Vape trade shows are increasing in popularity and regularity.<ref name=Williams2015>{{cite journal|last1=Williams|first1=Rebecca S|title=VapeCons: E-cigarette user conventions|journal=Journal of Public Health Policy|volume=36|issue=4|year=2015|pages=440–451|issn=0197-5897|doi=10.1057/jphp.2015.31|pmc=4641520|pmid=26424201}}</ref>
Vape shows include VapeBash, VapeCon, VapeXpo<ref name=Oser2016>{{cite news|url=http://vapenewsmagazine.com/august-2016/vaping-from-the-outside-is-trade-showconventiion-admission-worth-the-money|title=Vaping from the Outside: Is Trade Show/Conventiion Admission Worth the Money|author=Susan Oser|work=Vaping News Magazine|date=18 August 2016}}</ref> Vapestock, Vape-a-Palooza, Vapetoberfest, Vapor Gras,<ref name=Joyce2014>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonian.com/2014/07/01/is-the-e-cigarette-bubble-about-to-burst/|title=Is the E-Cigarette Bubble About to Burst?|author=Jaime Joyce|work=[[Washingtonian (magazine)|Washingtonian]]|date=1 July 2014}}</ref> and Canada Vape Expo.<ref name=Mclaren2015>{{cite news|url=http://torontoist.com/2016/08/toronto-vaping-darryl-mccoy/|title=We Went to Toronto’s Vape Olympics, Which Might Be the Last of its Kind in Ontario|author=Erik Mclaren|work=[[Torontoist]]|date=25 August 2016}}</ref> Vape Fest, which started in 2010, is an annual vape show hosted by different cities across the US.<ref name=Larson2014>{{cite news|author1=Eric Larson|title=Pimp My Vape: The Rise of E-Cigarette Hackers|url=http://mashable.com/2014/01/25/vaping-subculture/|accessdate=22 November 2014|publisher=Mashable|date=25 January 2014}}</ref> Vape Summit started in 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://cw39.com/2014/11/08/thousands-cloud-up-nrg-center-for-vape-summit-ii/|title=Thousands cloud up NRG Center for Vape Summit II|author=gtrudeaunf|work=New Fix|agency=CW39|date=14 November 2014}}</ref> Vapor World Expo began in 2014 at Rosemont, Illinois.<ref name=CSD2014>{{cite news|url=http://www.cstoredecisions.com/2014/01/08/vapor-world-expo-debut-near-chicago/|title=Vapor World Expo To Debut Near Chicago|author=CSD Staff|work=Convenience Store Decisions|agency=Harbor Communications|date=8 January 2014}}</ref> In May 2015 at Vape Summit 3 in Las Vegas, there was a cloud-chasing competition.<ref name=Burn-Callander2015>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/11583974/Are-you-a-vanilla-custard-cloud-chaser.html|title=Are you a vanilla custard cloud chaser?|author=Rebecca Burn-Callander|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=5 May 2015}}</ref> In May 2016 Vape Summit was held in Paris, France.<ref name=Dunand2016>{{cite news|url=http://www.vapingpost.com/2016/04/01/paris-vape-summit-a-meeting-from-vapers-to-vapers/|title=Paris Vape Summit, a meeting from vapers to vapers|author=Nathalie Dunand|publisher=VapingPost|date=1 April 2016}}</ref> The Vape Expo China, which started in 2015, is an annual vape show held in different cities in China.<ref name=YN2016>{{cite news|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/reed-huabo-organize-2nd-vape-123000379.html|title=Reed Huabo to Organize The 2nd Vape Expo China (Shenzhen)|work=[[Yahoo! News]]|agency=[[PR Newswire]]|date=18 July 2016}}</ref> Vape shop owners, agents, distributors, and vapers attend the trade show.<ref name=YN2016/>

{{For|the successor of WAPDA in East Pakistan|Bangladesh Power Development Board}} {{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Water and Power Development Authority |nativename = WAPDA |nativename_a = ('''واٹر اینڈ پاور ڈیولپمنٹ اتھارٹی''') |nativename_r = |logo = wapda logo.jpg |logo_width = 150 |logo_caption = WAPDA logo |seal = |seal_width = |seal_caption = |picture = Wapdahouse.jpg |picture_width = 250px |picture_caption = [[WAPDA House]], [[Lahore]], Pakistan |formed = {{Start date and years ago|1958|02|22}} |preceding1 = |preceding2 = |dissolved = |superseding = |jurisdiction = [[Government of Pakistan|Federal Government of Pakistan]] |headquarters = [[WAPDA House]], [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]] |coordinates = |employees = |budget = |minister1_name = |minister1_pfo = |minister2_name = |minister2_pfo = |chief1_name = [[Lt Gen]] Muzammil Hussain<ref>http://www.wapda.gov.pk/index.php/newsmedia/news-views/294-wapda-chairman-discusses-financing-for-wapda-projects-with-french-ambassador</ref> |chief1_position = [[Chairman]] of Wapda |chief2_name = |chief2_position = |agency_type =[[Electric power|Power]] and [[Hydrology]] |parent_agency = [[Ministry of Water and Power]] |child1_agency = |child2_agency = |keydocument1= |website ={{URL|http://www.wapda.gov.pk/}} |footnotes = |map = |map_width = |map_caption = }} The '''Water and Power Development Authority''' (WAPDA) ('''واٹر اینڈ پاور ڈیولپمنٹ اتھارٹی''') is a [[Government of Pakistan|government]]-owned [[public utility]] maintaining [[Electrical power industry|power]] and [[Water industry|water]] in [[Pakistan]], although it does not manage [[Thermal power station|thermal power]]. WAPDA includes [[Tarbela Dam|Tarbela]] and [[Mangla Dam|Mangla]] dams among its resources. Its headquarters are in [[Lahore]].
==History== WAPDA was established by an act of parliament in 1958<ref>[http://www.wapda.gov.pk/ Water and Power Development Authority]</ref> to unify the maintenance of [[infrastructure]] previously overseen by [[Subdivisions of Pakistan|provincial]] agencies. Its Chairmen included outstanding civil servants like [[Ghulam Ishaq Khan]], [[Ghulam Faruque Khan]] and [[Aftab Ghulam Nabi Kazi]] who were subsequently [[President of Pakistan]], Minister for Commerce and Economic Adviser, respectively. In October 2007, thermal power management was split into the newly formed [[Pakistan Electric Power Company]] (PEPCO).
==WAPDA Water vision 2025== {{main|WAPDA Water vision 2025}} WAPDA has formulated a comprehensive $25–33 billion National Water Resource and Hydropower Development Programme, entitled Water Vision 2025. The Water Vision 2025 projects are expected to generate 16,000 MW of hydroelectricity. Other goals are to prevent water shortages, limit drought and increase water storage for a growing population. Five massive hydropower projects have been announced by the President of Pakistan; these are to be completed by 2016, with a generation capacity of 9,500 MW. Two of the projects are ready for construction, while three are in the stages of feasibility studies and preparation of tender documents.<ref>[http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/Business/24-Sep-2008/Wapda-Vision-2025-to-help-solve-power-crisis Wapda Vision 2025]</ref>
Water Vision 2025 consists of three phases. Phase I was expected to start in 1993 but was delayed. The priority of water sector projects under Phase I of Water Vision 2025 are [[Gomal Dam]] (Khyber Pakhtunkhwa) , [[Mirani Dam]] and [[Mithan Kot Barrage]] at [[Kachhi Canal Project|Kachhi Canal]] (Balochistan) raising of [[Mangla Dam]] (Azad Kashmir), Greater Thal Canal phase I (Punjab) and Thar/ [[Rainee Canal Project|Rainee]] Canals phase I (Sindh). The total cost of these Phase I projects will be $2.467 billion with a construction period of five years. Under Phase II, [[Hingol Dam]], [[Balochistan Dam]] and [[Satpara Dam]] (Northern Areas), Chashma Right Bank Canal and [[Khurram Tangi Dam]] (NWFP), phase II of the Greater Thal Canal [[Akhori Dam]] and [[Sanjwal Dam]] (Punjab), phase II of Thar/Rainee Canals, Gajnai and Sehwan Barrage (Sindh) will be completed in 3–6 years, except [[Basha Dam]], which will take 8–10 years for its completion. The total cost of Phase II projects will be $8.94 billion. These 11 projects will have a storage capacity of {{convert|12790000|acre.ft|km3}}, would generate over 3362 mW of power, and would irrigate 14000 square kilometres of land. Under Phase III, [[Yugo Dam]], [[Skardu Dam]], [[Dhok Dam]], [[Rohtas Dam]], [[Naulang Dam]] and [[Khadji Dam]] will be completed.<ref> [http://www.pakissan.com/english/issues/water.vision.2025.shtml Water Vision 2025]</ref>
